title: Create a Node Library for Nx
description: Create a Node Library for an Nx workspace.

directory.description: A directory where the lib is placed
directory.x-prompt: Which directory do you want to create the library in?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.
linter.x-prompt: Which linter would you like to use?

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.
unitTestRunner.x-prompt: Which unit test runner would you like to use?

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update `tsconfig.base.json` for development experience.

compiler.description: The compiler used by the build and test targets.

importPath.description: The library name used to import it, like `@myorg/my-awesome-lib`. Must be a valid npm name.

rootDir.description: Sets the `rootDir` for TypeScript compilation. When not defined, it uses the project's root property, or `srcRootForCompilationRoot` if it is defined.

testEnvironment.description: The test environment to use if `unitTestRunner` is set to `jest`.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

strict.description: Whether to enable tsconfig strict mode or not.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project`. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.
